Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming.
I could tell that the people working behind the production did a lot of research on Tasmanian Tigers as well. It's amazing how much they understand about them.
They really put their heart into creating a movie that originated with kids who were asking questions and making observations. No wonder it's winning awards left and right

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.

Patty (tarynpatel) | 38433 comments This trailer looks perfect with approximately no Tom Cruise. Expected digressions aside I prefer this over what passed for thrillers for the last decade and guess we kind of got our last two in Crazy Heart and Gran Tor

Well,I am a dancer so automatically I liked this film. The only thing I didn't like was they didn't have much dancing as I thought there would be, replacing more dialogue. There were some good fight moves in there that were very cool, other then that the movie was pretty good!
This movie had some very good computer generated imagery in it. Only one part threw me though when two fighters fought cut up against a mountain whilst on horseback and it would break off

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as the 1985's "Too Beautiful to Die" and reworked again for Ridley Scott's 1987 masterpiece, "Someone to Watch Over Me".
There are a lot of positive moments found in this classic written and directed by Xavier Beauvois

If you are a fan of Zorro, Indiana Jones, or action in general this is a must-see. Directed by Republic's ace team of William Witney and John English and starring John Carroll & (authentic) Indian Chiefs with enough bad guys to necessitate the hero using the whip.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The townspeople form an alliance against the mother and son since they don’t really like or believe that the kids cat is an evil one and when there are lots of dead bodies, they begin to think it is probably just epileptic convulsions.
